summary: Meet Ronja and Rhion! A lovely commission for @marascv.  She found Rhion, an injured wild horse, trained him and over the course...
caption:
Meet Ronja and Rhion! A lovely commission for @marascv. 
She found Rhion, an injured wild horse, trained him and over the course of a few years he became her personal mount and now spends his life among a herd of semi-feral horses. 

Thank you so much for the chance of drawing these two sweet characters, they give me such a feel good vibe!

reblog.comment:

summary: It’s been a while since I had the chance to look over my work and start uploading some goodies.  This lovely lady and her cute...
caption:
It’s been a while since I had the chance to look over my work and start uploading some goodies. 

This lovely lady and her cute bird were all thanks to @hollowgale‘ s commission. I like to imagine the raven told her something very flattering and amusing.

Thanks again for the support!

blog.description:
**UNDER CONSTRUCTION**

Art blog of GlassesCatMurk! Also known as Murkrowzy!

DO NOT REPOST, STEAL OR DISTRIBUTE MY ART WITHOUT ASKING. Please, ask first! I don't bite hard ! Please credit back to me!

***Reblogs are really cool tho.***

Funfacts: My name is Murk/Murkrowzy! English only. (can read some Spanish!) I work mainly in traditional art & artisan crafts. This blog may contain blood, gore & swearing. It will *never* contain any NSFW!

Current obsession: CUPHEAD

Asks: Open

Trades: Open (DM me!)

Commissions: *I am working on a price sheet. I'll still gladly take a few!*

Twitter: Murkrowzy

summary: Using Personal Projects To Influence Work Projects
title: Using Personal Projects To Influence Work Projects
body:
Buckle the fuck up, this one might get long.

Here we go.


So in my last post, I talked mainly about the Earth illustration and how progress was going on that. Well, that illustration’s progress has now been halted for me to finally get some meaningful work done on the Take You To The Forest Illustration.

That's right! I’m not struggling with it anymore! woot! Let me tell you how that actually happened.

Well, it all started with me working on personal projects that have nothing to do with The Writer & The Artist. Fucking crazy right?

Anyway, I’m working on these illustrations that have tiny detail because they are on the smaller size, like an 8x10. And they have a deadline of like a couple days from now. I’ve had to force myself to slow down with these illustrations because the detail is small and I can’t use large painting gestures since the size is much smaller than these poetry book illustrations. (don’t fucking ask me why I chose a large size for the book illustrations, I think I was just excited about what they’d look like as originals after the book publishes) Getting used to the pace of these illustrations have made me learn what patience is. surprisingly. that might have been my biggest hang up with these larger illustrations.

WHO KNEW YOU NEEDED PATIENCE WHEN DEALING WITH WATERCOLOR THAT CAN’T BE FIXED WITH MORE PAINT ON TOP!! UGH (tip: that was sarcasm)

I have been having more luck sitting down and giving complete and slow focus on this painting and the parts that need the most work and care. Also another thing: I have a solid plan now. I was kinda winging it before, which usually works for me but wasn’t for this one painting. I was trying to do mostly just watercolor for all the little detail and things that I wanted to be done on it and it just wasn't going to work. Through these personal paintings I’ve found out I much prefer to use mixed media with my watercolors. Like ink and colored pencil and regular graphite pencil. I've also found that I really like seeing the pencil lines, the unrefined bits where I’m drawing and trying to figure out where to put a mark. I’ve always seen this as a flaw of mine because it looks unfinished to some people or it looks like there wasn’t that much thought into it. But I love seeing those lines, I always have, it gives the piece more energy and life I feel like. 

After I've given myself the permission to let the pencil lines be seen I’ve been having a fucking blast. The time it takes to slowly do things and be patient in seeing immediate results doesn’t matter anymore because I’m having such fun with it.

OMFG her face actually has color to it now!

As for the other mixed media in this one, I have a plan for black inks at the end….oo mysterious…


So this is where I leave you, and go get amped up to work on this again after I meet my other deadline. 

Laterz

Sally
